@website.css-coffeekraken-io.js.array.un.name: unique

ar.name: ar
ar.description: The array you want to filter

@website.css-coffeekraken-io.js.array.un.description: This function will return a filtered array without any duplicated

@website.css-coffeekraken-io.js.dom.quer.name: querySelectorLive

selector.name: selector
selector.description: The css selector that we are interested in

cb.name: cb
cb.description: The function to call with the newly added node

settings.name: settings
settings.description: An optional settings object to specify things like the rootNode to monitor, etc...

return.description: An SPromise instance on which to listen for nodes using the "node" event

@website.css-coffeekraken-io.js.dom.quer.description:
Observe the dom to get all the elements that matches a passed css selector at any point in time.
Be warned that this use the mutation observer API and will monitor all the document for new nodes. Make sure to use it
when you don't have the chance to use the custom elements API instead

@website.css-coffeekraken-io.sugar.style.name: Global reset
@website.css-coffeekraken-io.sugar.style.description:
These mixins allows you to apply some resets like `destyle` and/or the `sugar` one.
The `destyle` one is well known and you can find the documentation on their website.
The `sugar` one is our own that add some resets like setting max-width to 100% for images, and some more. Check our his own documentation page.

@website.css-coffeekraken-io.sugar.style.name: Destyle reset
@website.css-coffeekraken-io.sugar.style.description: These mixins allows you to apply the `destyle` reset easily.

@website.css-coffeekraken-io.sugar.style.name: Sugar reset
@website.css-coffeekraken-io.sugar.style.description: This mixin allows you to apply the `sugar` reset easily.

@website.css-coffeekraken-io.sugar.style.name: default
@website.css-coffeekraken-io.sugar.style.description: This declare the @font-face for the "<yellow>default</yellow> font family"

@website.css-coffeekraken-io.sugar.style.name: title
@website.css-coffeekraken-io.sugar.style.description: This declare the @font-face for the "<yellow>title</yellow> font family"

@website.css-coffeekraken-io.sugar.style.name: Typo
@website.css-coffeekraken-io.sugar.style.description:
These classes allows you to apply basic typo styles like `sub`, `strong`, etc... on any HTMLElement
These styles are defined in the `theme.typo` theme settings.

@website.css-coffeekraken-io.sugar.style.name: Icon
@website.css-coffeekraken-io.sugar.style.description:
These classes represent all the icons that you have listed in your project using the @sugar.icon.classes mixin.
By using this mixin, your icons will be accessible using the same s-icon:{name} classes
independently of the icon source that can be *Fontawesome** or your **Filesystem**.
These providers are the one that we support for now but others can be added if needed.

@website.css-coffeekraken-io.sugar.style.name: Toggle
@website.css-coffeekraken-io.sugar.style.description:
These classes allows you to display any HTMLElement as a toggle.
Toggles are element that have at least 2 states. Active and unactive.
This active state respect these rules:

- &:active
- &:focus
- &:focus-within
- input:checked + &
- input:checked + .s-menu + &
- :active > &
- :focus > &
- :focus-within > &
- &:has(input:checked)
- input:checked +
> &
- input:checked + .s-menu +
> &

example.title: Toggles
example.code: burger

@website.css-coffeekraken-io.sugar.style.name: Disabled
@website.css-coffeekraken-io.sugar.style.description:
These classes allows you to apply the disabled style on any HTMLElement.
This make sure *no pointer events** stays active as well as displaying the **not-allowed cursor**.

example.title: Disabled
example.code: <input type="text" class="s-input s-disabled" placeholder="I'm disabled" />

@website.css-coffeekraken-io.sugar.style.name: Fit Sizes
@website.css-coffeekraken-io.sugar.style.description:
These classes allows you to apply a fit size on any HTMLElement.
On image and video, uses `object-fit` property, on all others,
simply fill the element using an absolute position, top: 0, left: 0 and width/height: 100%.

contain
none

@website.css-coffeekraken-io.sugar.style.name: Scale
@website.css-coffeekraken-io.sugar.style.description:
These classes allows to apply a scale to any supported UI elements.
This scale does not use the transform property but increase actual values like `padding`,
`margin`, etc... In fact, all the properties setted with the `sugar.scallable` function.
It's usually a good practice to set the `font-size` of your UI element to `sugar.scalable(1rem)`
and then to set inner values using `em` unit.

@website.css-coffeekraken-io.sugar.style.name: Offsize
@website.css-coffeekraken-io.sugar.style.description:
These classes allows you to apply an offsize to any HTMLElement.
An offsize is a "space" that you want to ADD to the width/height of an element.
You can specify where you want to add this offsize like for margin and padding by using the "inline" and "block" notation.

example.title: All around
Inline
Block
Inline end

@website.css-coffeekraken-io.sugar.style.name: Shape
@website.css-coffeekraken-io.sugar.style.description:
These classes allows you to apply a shape to any elements that support it using the
`border-radius: sugar.border.radius(shape);` statement.

example.title: Shape on buttons
example.code: Default shape Square shape Pill shape

@website.css-coffeekraken-io.sugar.style.name: Widths
@website.css-coffeekraken-io.sugar.style.description:
These classes allows to apply some width to any HTMLElement.
These widths are defined in the `theme.width` theme settings.

example.code: s-width:0
s-width:10
s-width:20
s-width:30
s-width:40
s-width:50
s-width:60
s-width:70
s-width:80
s-width:90
s-width:100

@website.css-coffeekraken-io.sugar.style.description: These classes allows you to apply some white-space style on any HTMLElement

global reset.name: Global reset
global reset.description:
These mixins allows you to apply some resets like `destyle` and/or the `sugar` one.
The `destyle` one is well known and you can find the documentation on their website.
The `sugar` one is our own that add some resets like setting max-width to 100% for images, and some more. Check our his own documentation page.

destyle reset.name: Destyle reset
destyle reset.description: These mixins allows you to apply the `destyle` reset easily.

sugar reset.name: Sugar reset
sugar reset.description: This mixin allows you to apply the `sugar` reset easily.

default.name: default
default.description: This declare the @font-face for the "<yellow>default</yellow> font family"

title.name: title
title.description: This declare the @font-face for the "<yellow>title</yellow> font family"

tooltip.name: Tooltip
tooltip.description: These classes allows you display nice tooltips on any HTMLElement

typo.name: Typo
typo.description:
These classes allows you to apply basic typo styles like `sub`, `strong`, etc... on any HTMLElement
These styles are defined in the `theme.typo` theme settings.

example.title: h1
example.code: Earnest Vandervort

example.title: h2
example.code: Boyd Ullrich

example.title: h3
example.code: Ms. Alfonso Armstrong

example.title: h4

example.title: h6
example.code: Louis Zieme

example.title: p

example.title: lead
example.code:
<lead class="s-typo:lead">
      Amanda Conn
  </lead>

example.title: hr
example.code:
<hr class="s-typo:hr">
      Ms. Alex Dach
  </hr>

example.title: pre:not([class])
example.code:

      Lorraine Maggio

example.title: code:not(pre > code)
example.code:
<code:not(pre > code) class="s-typo:code:not(pre > code)">

icon.name: Icon
icon.description:
These classes represent all the icons that you have listed in your project using the @sugar.icon.classes mixin.
By using this mixin, your icons will be accessible using the same s-icon:{name} classes
independently of the icon source that can be *Fontawesome** or your **Filesystem**.
These providers are the one that we support for now but others can be added if needed.
